revised_title: Effects of Temperature on Torsional Rigidity of Metal Wires
tldr: This study investigates the effects of temperature on the modulus of torsional rigidity of various metal wires, including copper, iron, platinum, gold, silver, aluminum, tin, lead, and cadmium. The research finds that the modulus of rigidity increases with time and temperature, with different metals exhibiting varying degrees of change in rigidity and internal viscosity.
